metadata.title: CVE-2022-22720 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier fails to close inbound connectionwhen errors are encountered discarding the request body, exposing theserver to HTTP Request Smuggling

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5').
